intro: Diplycosia crenulata, commonly known as the waxy leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, waxy leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster and bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
